nodes.bodyText: I don't support spurious changes like this
Yeah, I fixed the CheckStyle errors.  I'm not sure why these aren't being caught when others commit.  @ddsharpe, any ideas?

I fully support changes like this.  This is technical debt resolution.  The original code did not meet our coding standard, and is therefore technical debt.  The code was originally allowed in because nobody caught it, and the checkstyle implementation was flawed.
Same, technical debt resolution.  Ok by me.
this documentation does not tell me anything more that the variable name did

nodes.bodyText: Right... again, this was CheckStyle.  It's a CS issue if you have JavaDoc but without text.

nodes.bodyText: this makes me nervous - can you explain more about why we do this?

Yes, we've had this behavior for a while.  It's even recommended in the client sample watch.  You don't want the HTTP request timing out underneath a watch that doesn't have any traffic for a long time.
this seems to repeat a lot - can this not be refactored?
i would like to see a comment here explaining why - for future generations of developers
We're generally using String.isNullOrEmpty rather than this combination
